Kamal Ahmed wrote:

> I really appreciate your response, but adding a boolean isAcceptMatch()
> method to WmLoggerFilter, would mean changing the class which is under test.
> Could this be an acceptable test case?

In general, adding read-only, side-effect-free methods to a class is 
safe. One possible problem would be returning a Collection and letting 
clients add/remove elements--this is why Java has unmodifiable 
collection wrappers.

So I would just add the method (but call it acceptsMatch()) and use it 
in the tests.
